column1: Table 5.2: Risk of PCa identified by systemic PCa biopsy in relation to low PSA values [173]

In asymptomatic men with a prostate-specific antigen (PSA) level between 3–10 ng/mL and 
a normal digital rectal examination (DRE), repeat the PSA test prior to further investigations.

• 
an additional serum, urine biomarker test.

Stop early diagnosis of PCa based on life expectancy and performance status; men who 
have a life-expectancy of < 15 years are unlikely to benefit.
